amendment.description: To require the Federal Emergency Management Agency to allocate at least $4,450,000 of any funds previously made available in response to the September 11, 2001, attacks in New York City for continued mental health counseling services for emergency services personnel requiring additional assistance as a result of the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.

vote.text: Amendment SA 3651 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 3651 proposed by Senator Clinton. (consideration: CR S9201; text: CR S9201) To require the Federal Emergency Management Agency to allocate at least $4,450,000 of any funds previously made available in response to the September 11, 2001, attacks in New York City for continued mental health counseling services for emergency services personnel requiring additional assistance as a result of the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks.
